page.title: 03The History of My House
page.content: My house is called Millemont, which means a thousand hills. Where it now stands there used to be a small Jersey farmhouse with stables and barns which were built in the 19th century and belonged to my grandfather. In 1969, my father had the outbuildings knocked down and had Millemont built. It is copied from a French chateau which my father liked very much. The entrance to the house is an archway. At the top of the arch is a granite stone with my father's and mother's initals engraved on it with the date of the house (1969). This is an old Jersey custom to show who owned the house and when it was built.
